page.title: 04DONNINGTON BREWERY
page.content: Donnington Brewery is a small{brewery in a beautiful valley about 3km from Stow. There has been a{mill}on the site for 900 years and the water wheel is still used to pump water. The Brewery has been there for 120 years. The{quality of Donnington Ale}is due to the{fresh spring water }called liquor by the brewer. Most of the beer is put into barrels and sold in the 17 Inns belonging to the Brewery. Donnington's products are recognised by{CAMRA}as a genuine British quality beer. The{Mill Pond}has become home for many species of{waterfowl}which all adds to the charm of this site.
